instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT is PPBUS_G3H backlight voltage entering the backlight boost circuit once the transistor has been told to allow it through. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Water Damage - No Video
threads.message:
I get this board and i wondering if you guys can help me out.
The board is 80% fine, however the liquid hit the J8300 and close to that. 
The PIN 1 on J8300 looks like have short, so i replaced also the cable.

Around <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> is pretty clean, don't have corrosion.
* I get external video

Measurements:

<TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>
- Pin 1 2 5 6 = 0v
- Pin 3 4 = 12v

L8300
- Pin 1 = 0
- Pin 2 = 5V for 10 Seconds after 0v

<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>

Pin 1 2 3 4 5 = 0.4V
Pin 6 = 5v
Pin 7 = 0v
Pin 8 = 5v
Pin 9 = 12v
Pin 10 = 12v
Pin 11 = 12v
Pin 12 = 0v
Pin 13 = 0.2v
Pin 14 = 0.2v
Pin 15 = 5v
pin 16 = 5v
Pin 17 = 0
Pin = 5V
Pin 19 20 21 22 23 24 = 0V

SMC LID = 3.4V
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> - 3.4 after 10 sec goes to 0v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SO_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> = 0V

Diodo Mode Pin 1 on J8300 - 1.1v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Water Damage - No Video
threads.message: LCD not recognized. L8300 pin 1 having 0V and pin 2 at 5V is not possible. Flow is from pin 1 to 2. If connector is not damaged then first thing is to connect a known good 2015 LCD assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Water Damage - No Video
threads.message:
Yes. You are right, Duke about Pin 1 and 2.
I Just tested with another screen 2013 and i get mark folder with light in the back.
I will try check  the same screen and see what happen. 

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Water Damage - No Video
threads.message:
I have had water get in under the clutch cover and wreck the LCD / backlight board. I have replaced a fuse and a connector on that sub board when I was in a bind for parts.
You can easily replace that LCD cable as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Water Damage - No Video
threads.message:
I did, but still don't get backlight. 
I guess the problem is on the <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Water Damage - No Video
threads.message: What is voltage on pin 1 of LCD connector? Working LCD must be connected and image must be present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Water Damage - No Video
threads.message: 0.2 V Pin 1 and i get question mark with light in the back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Water Damage - No Video
threads.message: Did you try a known good LCD assembly? LCD needs to "talk" to <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> to enable it.
